data.title: IGPBS Faculty
data.meta_description: The faculty at UNMC who participate in the IGPBS have appointments in the College of Medicine or the Cancer Research Graduate Program.
data.text:
Maher Y. Abdalla, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Pathology, Microbiology and Immunology

Research focus: Reactive Oxygen Species (ROS), Heme Oxygenase-1 (HO-1) and immune cells in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) and prostate cancer.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, CR and IPID

Hesham Ali, PhD

Dean, Department of Information Science and Technology (UNO)

Research focus: Developing secure and energy-aware wireless infrastructure to address tracking and monitoring problems in medical environments, particularly to study mobility profiling for various groups and to conduct a population analysis approach to advancing healthcare research.

Associated Doctoral Program: BISB

Yazen Alnouti, PhD

Professor, Department of Pharmaceutical Sciences

Research focus: Drug metabolism and pharmacokinetics (DMPK), with a focus on the application of Bioanalytical Chemistry, in vitro and in vivo animal models to support ADMET (absorption, distribution, metabolism, excretion and toxicity) and pharmacokinetic (PK) studies; Biomarkers for hepato-biliary diseases based on bile acid metabolism by sulfation.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, CR and IPID

UNMC Award Recipient: 2014 Distinguished Scientist

Windy Alonso, PhD, RN

Assistant Professor, College of Nursing

Research focus: Understanding heart failure with preserved ejection fraction; developing interventions to promote exercise in adults with heart failure that can be applied in diverse and underserved settings.

Associated Doctoral Program: IPMM

UNMC Award Recipient: 2023 New Investigator

Daniel R. Anderson, MD, PhD

Associate Professor, Department of Internal Medicine - Cardiology

Research focus: Molecular and cellular immunology; innate immunity (preexisting immunity) and how such immune responses contribute to the mechanisms of cardiovascular disease processes, specifically focused on underlying mechanisms of viral myocarditis, atherosclerotic disease and the impact inflammation has on cardiac rhythm abnormalities.

Associated Doctoral Program: IPMM

Ann Anderson Berry, MD, PhD

Professor, Department of Pediatrics - Neonatology

Research focus: Nutrition of the ELBW infant, preterm infant protein requirements, human milk fortification, Vitamin D metabolism in the mother-infant dyad, Vitamin A deficiency, Vitamin E metabolism.

Associated Doctoral Program: IPMM

UNMC Award Recipient: 2016 Interprofessional Academy of Educators; 2016 Spirit of Community Service

Leonardo da Silva Augusto, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Pathology, Microbiology and Immunology

Research focus: Cellular metabolism changes in neuroinflammation, neurodegeneration caused by chronic Toxoplasma gondii infection.

Associated Doctoral Program: IPID

Josue Avecillas-Chasin, MD, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Neurosurgery

Research focus: Detailed description of the brain circuits and how this will impact our neuromodulation techniques when applied in a personalized manner.

Associated Doctoral Program: NSC

Return To Top

Aditya Bade, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Pharmacology and Experimental Neuroscience

Research focus: HIV pathogenesis, antiretroviral therapy (ART) and ART associated toxicity using murine and in vitro models.

Associated Doctoral Program: NSC

Hamid Band, MD, PhD

Professor, Eppley Cancer Institute

Research focus: Regulation of receptor signaling by endocytic traffic; Cbl-family and CHIP ubiquitin ligases; EHD-family endocytic recycling regulators; mouse genetic models; cancer biology;and stem cell biology.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, CR, IPID and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2014 Research Leadership

Vimla Band, PhD

Professor and Chair, Department of Genetics, Cell Biology and Anatomy

Research focus: Delineate molecular mechanisms of early steps in transformation of mammary epithelial cells with the goal of identifying novel molecular diagnostic/prognostic markers and potential therapy targets of breast cancers.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, CR and MGCB

Christopher Barrett, MD

Assistant Professor, Department of Surgery

Research focus: Interface of coagulation, fibrinolysis and inflammatory perturbations after traumatic injury and major surgery at the molecular and cellular level.

Associated Doctoral Program: IPMM

Kiran Bastola, PhD

Professor, Department of Information Science and Technology (UNO)

Research focus: Computational biology including gene regulation with noncoding RDA, mining for interesting patterns form genomic sequences for use in molecular diagnostics, public health, secondary metabolism and biology of the mitochondria in disease, as well as extreme environments.

Associated Doctoral Program: BISB

Surinder K. Batra, PhD

Professor and Chair, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Research focus: Structure/function analysis of tumor-associated genes; cancer diagnostics, cancer vaccines; monoclonal antibodies, genetic engineering of antibodies.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, CR and IPID

UNMC Award Recipient: 2012 Scientist Laureate; 2010 Outstanding Faculty Mentor of Graduate Students

Robert Bennett, PhD

Professor, Department of Internal Medicine - Diabetes, Endocrinology and Metabolism (DEM)

Research focus: Antifibrotic effects of the hormone relaxin and related peptides; expression and signaling of relaxin receptors; internalization and degradation of relaxin, insulin and related hormones; the role of relaxin in adipose function.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, IPMM and MGCB

Raymond Bergan, MD

Professor, Department of Internal Medicine - Oncology and Hematology

Research focus: Understanding how cancer cells regulate transformation to a high motility metastatic phenotype, and how that process can be therapeutically modulated.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, CR and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2023 Distinguished Scientist

Kishor K. Bhakat, PhD

Associate Professor, Department of Genetics, Cell Biology and Anatomy

Research focus: Understanding the molecular mechanisms and alter the damage repair pathways and gene expression in tumor cells to promote therapy resistance and tumor recurrence, and develop second line of interventions to prevent tumor recurrence and metastasis.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, CR and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2014 New Investigator

Keshore Bidasee, PhD

Professor, Department of Pharmacology and Experimental Neuroscience

Research focus: Delineating the pathogenic trajectories that contribute to vascular diseases in organs including the brain, heart, kidney, and lung during HIV-1 infection and diabetes mellitus.

Associated Doctoral Programs: IPMM and NSC

Jennifer Black, PhD

Professor, Eppley Cancer Institute

Research focus: Colon cancer; endometrial cancer; pancreatic cancer; cell signaling (kinases and phosphatases) cell cycle regulation; control of protein translation in cancer; protein kinase C; PP2A.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, CR and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2021 Outstanding Faculty Mentor of Junior Faculty; 2015 Distinguished Scientist

Jennifer Blackford, PhD

Professor, Munroe-Meyer Institute

Research focus: Understanding the neural basis of anxiety, including mapping the basic neurocircuitry of anxiety, studies of anxiety neurobiology in children, and studies examining the role of anxiety alcohol use disorders.

Associated Doctoral Program: NSC

UNMC Award Recipient: 2023 Distinguished Scientist

Erika I. Boesen, PhD

Associate Professor, Department of Cellular and Integrative Physiology

Research focus: Iron-mediated kidney damage in lupus nephritis; renal control of salt and water homeostasis.

Associated Doctoral Program: IPMM

UNMC Award Recipient: 2023 Interprofesstional Academy of Educators; 2014 New Investigator

Sandipan Brahma, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Genetics, Cell Biology and Anatomy

Research focus: Mechanisms regulating chromatin structure, how cells use these mechanisms to establish and maintain gene expression programs, and the implications of these mechanisms for human health.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, CR, and MGCB

M. Jana Broadhurst, MD, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Pathology, Microbiology and Immunology

Research focus: Emerging and englected infectious diseases diagnostic assay development for clinical and public health applications.

Associated Doctoral Program: IPID

UNMC Award Recipient: 2022 New Investigator

Shilpa Buch, PhD

Professor, Department of Pharmacology and Experimental Neuroscience

Research focus: Therapeutic strategies that may enhance neural function and survival in NeuroAIDS, with possible implication in other neurodegenerative diseases.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, IPID and NSC

UNMC Award Recipient: 2015 Scientist Laureate

Keely Buesing, MD, FACS

Associate Professor, Department of Surgery

Research focus: Large animal and pulmonary cellular investigation of novel therapeutics targeting Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS).

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, IPID and IPMM

UNMC Award Recipient: 2017 New Investigator

Siddappa Byrareddy, PhD

Professor, Department of Pharmacology and Experimental Neuroscience

Research focus: Understanding and developing therapeutics for emerging/re-emerging viruses, focusing on HIV, Zika and SARS-CoV-2.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, CR, IPID, MGCB and NSC

UNMC Award Recipient:2017 Distinguished Scientist

Return To Top

Steve Caplan, PhD

Professor, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Research focus: Study of endocytic membrane trafficking, receptor recycling, vesicular transport, endosomes, mechanisms of mitochondrial fission/fusion, ciliogenesis and mechanisms by which primary cilia are generated, and centrosome biology.

Associated Doctoral Program: BMB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2011 Outstanding Faculty Mentor of Graduate Students

Rey Carabeo, PhD

Professor, Department of Pathology, Microbiology and Immunology

Research focus: Cytoskeletal dynamics and mechanostransduction in Chlamydia invasion and pathogen modulation of host epithelial cell-extracellular matrix interaction; Transcriptomic studies of Chlamydia stress adaption.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, IPID and MGCB

Carol A. Casey, PhD

Professor, Department of Internal Medicine - Gastroenterology and Hepatology

Research focus: Biochemistry of alcoholism and digestive system diseases.

Associated Doctoral Program: BMB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2023 Research Leadership; 2016 Outstanding Faculty Mentor of Junior Faculty

Kishore Challagundla, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Research focus: Role of extra cellular vesicles (EV's) and the non-coding RNAs in affecting immunotherapy response and escaping immune surveillance in pediatric cancers, in particular neuroblastoma and acute myeloid leukemia.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, CR and MGCB

Gurumurthy Channabasavaiah, PhD

Professor, Department of Genetics, Cell Biology & Anatomy

Research focus: Development and improvement of transgenic and genome editing technologies; development of versatile animal model resources and tools.

Associated Doctoral Programs: MGCB and NSC

Sujata Chaudhari, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Pathology, Microbiology and Immunology

Research focus: Arthropod physiology and bacterial pathogenesis; study of tick vector physiology with focus on cuticle development and pathogen transmission; chitin metabolism in arthropods using Tribolium castaneum as a genetic model system; Staphylococcal metabolism and stress response.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB and IPID

Kuan-Hua Chen, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Neurological Sciences

Research focus: Changes in the brain and socioemotional functioning in persons with dementia.

Associated Doctoral Program: NSC

Pi-Wan Cheng, PhD

Professor, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Research focus: Study of the mechanism of altered glycosylation in human disease.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, CR, IPID and MGCB

Dahn Clemens, PhD

Professor, Department of Internal Medicine - Gastroenterology and Hepatology

Research focus: Role of inflammation in the pathogenesis of cardiovascular disease; molecular mechanisms by which reactive oxygen species cause inflammation that leads to the initiation and profession of cardiovascular disease.

Associated Doctoral Program: CR

Martin Conda-Sheridan, PhD

Associate Professor, College of Pharmacy

Research focus: Design of complex multifunctional biomaterials and bioactive small molecules for medicinal applications.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, CR and IPID

UNMC Award Recipient: 2016 New Investigator

Kenneth Cowan, MD, PhD

Director and Professor, Eppley Cancer Institute

Research focus: Tumor suppressor genes, breast cancer; mechanisms associated with development of multi-drug resistance and the regulation of expression of drug resistance genes in human tumor cells.

Associated Doctoral Program: CR

Jesse Cox, MD, PhD

Associate Professor, Department of Pathology, Microbiology and Immunology

Research focus: Human DNA identification laboratory, HLA and transplant, and blood banking and transfusion medicine.

Associated Doctoral Program: IPID

Return To Top

John S. Davis, PhD

Professor, Director of Research and Development - Olson Center for Women's Health, Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology

Research focus: Women's health; Reproductive endocrinology and cancer; Mechanisms of hormone action.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, CR and IPMM

UNMC Award Recipient: 2023 Research Leadership

Paul Davis, PhD

Professor, Department of Biology (UNO)

Research focus: Investigating and developing novel approaches to prevent and treat human parasitic infections, using approaches that include molecular biology, bioinformatics, -omics, high-content imaging, and genetics.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BISB and IPID

Rebecca (Oberley-) Deegan, PhD

Professor, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Research focus: Role of free radicals signaling to transform fibroblasts and inflammatory cells in normal tissue, which results in damage to these tissues; understanding the mechanisms by which ROS promote radiation induced fibrosis and prostate cancer progression.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, CR and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2019 Distinguished Scientist; 2015 New Investigator

Cyrus Desouza, MBBS

Professor, Department of Internal Medicine – Diabetes, Endocrinology and Metabolism (DEM)

Research focus: Improving outcomes in diabetes and obesity patients using treatment algorithms; mechanisms of diabetes and metabolic syndrome on vascular and brain function.

Associated Doctoral Programs: IPMM and NSC

UNMC Award Recipient: 2014 Distinguished Scientist

Punita Dhawan, PhD

Professor, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Research focus: Development of novel therapeutic targets for Gastrointestinal Cancer progression and chemoresistance; Role of signaling pathways and cancer stem cells involved in this process using cell culture, mouse and organoid models.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, CR and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2019 Distinguished Scientist

Bin Duan, PhD

Associate Professor, Department of Internal Medicine - Cardiology

Research focus: Integrate novel biomaterials, advanced biofabrication of tissue engineering to create multi-scale complexity within engineered tissue to understand the fundamentals of cell-material interactions and mimic the native tissue for tissue regeneration.

Associated Doctoral Programs: CR, MGCB and NSC

UNMC Award Recipient: 2018 New Investigator

Andrew Dudley, PhD

Associate Professor, Department of Genetics, Cell Biology and Anatomy

Research focus: Mechanisms that regulate the development and homeostasis of musculoskeletal tissue using methods from embryology, molecular biology, cell biology, genetics and tissue engineering, with the goal of generating novel therapies for regenerative medicine.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, IPMM and MGCB

Return To Top

Benson Edagwa, PhD

Associate Professor, Department of Pharmacology and Experimental Neuroscience

Research focus: Design, development and evaluation of antiretroviral prodrugs, development of long acting slow effective release ART (LASER ART) and their application to testing in cell and small animal based assays.

Associated Doctoral Programs: IPID and NSC

UNMC Award Recipient: 2023 Distinguished Scientist; 2019 New Investigator

Dalia Elgamal, PhD

Assistant Professor, Eppley Cancer Institute

Research focus: Pathogenesis of B-cell malignancies, including immunosuppressive microenvironmental interactions and the gut microbiome, and evaluating novel anti-tumor therapeutics strategies.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, CR and IPID

James Eudy, PhD

Associate Professor, Department of Genetics, Cell Biology and Anatomy

Research focus: Next Generation DNA Sequencing strategies for rare Mendelian disease gene identification and functional genomic technologies; biomedical interest in cancer, cardiovascular disease and virology.

Associated Doctoral Programs: CR and MGCB

Return To Top

Kurt Fisher, MD, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Pathology, Microbiology and Immunology

Research focus: Identification and evaluation of novel targets for therapy in gastrointestional tumors with K-Ras mutation; GI tract, liver, and solid organ transplant pathology.

Associated Doctoral Programs: CR and IPID

Howard S. Fox, MD, PhD

Professor, Department of Neurological Sciences

Research focus: Neurodegeneration, viral infections, single cell analyses of the brain, translational research in neuroscience.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, IPID and NSC

UNMC Award Recipient: 2013 Scientist Laureate

Return To Top

Lie Gao, MD, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Anesthesiology

Research focus: Role of skeletal muscle Nrf2 in exercise-induced cardioprotection, with a focus of extracellular vesicle-mediated cell-to-cell antioxidant communication, by employing skeletal muscle-specific transgenic mouse lines.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BISB and IPMM

Howard E. Gendelman, MD

Professor, Department of Pharmacology and Experimental Neuroscience

Research focus: Development and testing of HIV-1 cure strategies; Basic and clinical studies on novel medicines to treat Parkinson's disease.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, IPID, IPMM and NSC

UNMC Award Recipient: 2023 Faculty IP Innovation & Commercialization Award; 2014 Outstanding Faculty Mentor of Graduate Students

Dario Ghersi, MD, PhD

Associate Professor, College of Information Science and Technology (UNO)

Research focus: Large-scale cancer genomics datasets, integrating different types of data (including protein structure) to gain insight into the molecular bases of cancer and immune system function.

Associated Doctoral Program: BISB

Gargi Ghosal, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Genetics, Cell Biology and Anatomy

Research focus: Understand the basic science underlying replication stress response in cancer and aging; identify new targets and bio-markers for cancer therapies and facilitate the development of strategies to overcome drug resistance and improve cancer therapies.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, CR and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2023 New Investigator

Stephen Gliske, PhD

Associate Professor, Department of Neurosurgery

Research focus: Assessment of epileptic tissue/networks to help guide resective surgery, monitoring of neonatal sleep, and analysis of microelectrode recordings to understand interactions between sleep and movement disorders disease and treatment

Associated Doctoral Program: NSC

Santhi Gorantla, PhD

Professor, Department of Pharmacology and Experimental Neuroscience

Research focus: Humanized mouse models for HIV brain infection; influence of substance use on brain HIV latency, inflammation and pathogenesis.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, IPID and NSC

UNMC Award Recipient: 2014 Distinguished Scientist

Karen Gould, PhD

Professor, Department of Genetics, Cell Biology and Anatomy

Research focus: Estrogen receptor alpha regulation of B cell receptor signaling, B cell fate, and lupus pathogenesis. B cell transcriptomics and genomics.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BISB, IPID, IPMM and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2018 Interprofessional Academy of Educators; 2018-2019 Visionary Leadership in Education

Timothy C. Greiner, MD

Professor, Department of Pathology, Microbiology and Immunology

Research focus: Etiology and progression of lymphoma by examining the mutational spectra of oncogenes and tumor suppresser genes.

Associated Doctoral Program: IPID

Chittibabu (Babu) Guda, PhD

Professor, Department of Genetics, Cell Biology and Anatomy

Research focus: Development and application of computational methods for genomic data analyses including cancer genomics, functional annotation of proteins, pathways, networks and systems in biomedical research.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BISB and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2023 Research Leadership; 2014 Distinguished Scientist

Valentina Gumenyuk, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Neurological Sciences

Research focus: MEG-EGG-MRI Neuroimaging in normal and abnormal aging. Cognitive disfunctions and sleep distrubances in patients with epilepsy, dementia of different forms. Presurgical brain mapping in adult and pediatric patients.

Associated Doctoral Program: NSC

Rebekah Gundry, PhD

Professor, Department of Cellular and Integrative Physiology

Research focus: Development and application innovative mass spectrometry (MS) technologies, bioinformatics tools, and methodologies to transform our understanding of cell surface proteins and glycans, and answer outstanding questions in stem cell biology and cardiac pathology.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB and IPMM

UNMC Award Recipient: 2022 Distinguished Scientist

Return To Top

Lynda Harris, PhD

Associate Professor, Department of Obstetrics and Gynocology

Research focus: Studying placental function in animals and humans; developing obstetric nanomedicines, placental-specific drug delivery systems and other treatments for placental dysfunction.

Associated Doctoral Programs: IPID and IPMM

Kyle Hewitt, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Genetics, Cell Biology & Anatomy

Research focus: Hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell control of blood production during development and/or regeneration following disease or injury; transcriptional and epigentic mechanisms that cause hematologic disorders; tissue and cellular heterogeneity; CRISPR/Cas9-mediated disruption of gene regulatory networks and cell signaling mechanisms.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BISB, CR, IPID and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2020 New Investigator

Michael A. (Tony) Hollingsworth, PhD

Professor, Eppley Cancer Institute

Research focus: Basic and translational research in pancreatic cancer, including investigation of the biology of tumor progression, discovery and validation of biomarkers of early detection and disease progression, development and testing of novel therapeutics, including targeted therapies and immunotherapies.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, CR and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2014 Outstanding Faculty Mentor of Graduate Students

Sarah Holstein, MD, PhD

Professor, Department of Internal Medicine - Oncology and Hematology

Research focus: Development of novel agents for the treatment of multiple myeloma and pancreatic cancer, with a particular focus on Rab inhibitors of the isoprenoid biosynthetic.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB and CR

UNMC Award Recipient: 2020 Distinguished Scientist

Karen Honeycutt, PhD, MEd, MLS(ASCP)SM

Associate Professor, College of Allied Health Professions – Clinical Laboratory Science Education

Research focus: Effective and efficient educational methodologies; active learning strategies, online and multimedia educational platforms; incorporation of professionalism in MLS education; women and the academic doctoral degree path.

Associated Doctoral Program: IPID

UNMC Award Recipient: 2017-2018 Varner Educator Laureate; 2016 Interprofessional Academy of Educators; 1996 Outstanding Teaching Award

Corey Hopkins, PhD

Professor, Pharmaceutical Sciences

Research focus: Design, synthesis and optimization of biologically active small molecules as in vivo probes, drug discovery lead compounds and preclinical candidates.

Associated Doctoral Programs: CR, IPID and NSC

UNMC Award Recipient: 2017 Distinguished Scientist

R. Katherine (Kate) Hyde, PhD

Associate Professor, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Research focus: Understand the mechanisms that regulate leukemia development; develop treatments for hematological malignancies.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, CR and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2020 Distinguished Scientist; 2018 Sprit of Community Service; 2016 New Investigator

Return To Top

Javeed Iqbal, PhD

Professor, Department of Pathology, Microbiology and Immunology

Research focus: Molecular signatures to improve diagnosis and outcome prediction in Non-Hodgkin’s Lymphoma; gene expression profiling and pathway targeted therapy in peripheral T-cell lymphoma; characterization of key molecular signatures in natural killer cell malignancies.

Associated Doctoral Programs: CR and IPID

UNMC Award Recipient: 2018 Distinguished Scientiest

Return To Top

Maneesh Jain, PhD

Professor, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Research focus: Development of genetically engineered antibody fragments for improved radioimmunotherapy for solid tumors; development of serum assays for the early diagnosis of lethal pancreatic cancer.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, CR and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2020 Outstanding Faculty Mentor of Junior Faculty; 2020 Research Leadership Award; 2016 Distinguished Scientist

Keith R. Johnson, PhD

Professor, Eppley Cancer Institute

Research focus: The role the cell adhesion molecules (cadherins) play in metastasis.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, CR and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2015 Outstanding Faculty Mentor of Junior Faculty; 2014 Research Leadership

Shantaram S. Joshi, PhD

Professor, Department of Genetics, Cell Biology and Anatomy

Research focus: Improve therapy for human B lymphocytic malignancies and pediatric cancers by means of translational research involving molecular characterization of progressive/therapy resistant maliganant cells.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2011 Outstanding Teaching Award; 2017-2018 Inspirational Mentor of Educators

Return To Top

Kusum Kharbanda, PhD

Professor, Department of Internal Medicine - Gastroenterology and Hepatology

Research focus: Alcohol liver injury with emphasis on alcohol's deleterious effect in altering the methionine metabolic pathway and lowering the ratio of the methyl donor, SAM, to its product, SAH.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, IPMM and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2013 Distinguished Scientist

Scott Koepsell, MD, PhD

Associate Professor, Department of Pathology & Microbiology

Research focus: Transfusion medicine; cellular therapy; molecular diagnostics.

Associated Doctoral Program: IPID

Zeljka Korade, DVM, PhD

Professor, Department of Pediatrics

Research focus: Cholesterol metabolism in the central nervous system; study of an inborn error of metabolism Smith-Lemli-Opitz syndrome; desmosterolosis; development of neuronal cell lines with defects in different enzymes of cholesterol biosynthesis pathway and their characterization.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB and NSC

Mohan Krishnan, PhD

Associate Professor, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Research focus: Pathophysiology of Tranfusion-associated Necrotizing Enterocolitis (TA-NEC) and Systemic Inflammatory Response Syndrome(SIRS) in premature infants.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB and MGCB

Sushil Kumar, PhD

Associate Professor, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Research focus: Tumor microenvironment; Pancreatic pathologies including pancreatic cancer and pancreatitis using multiple murine models, organoid, and 3D cell culture-based technologies.

Associated Doctoral Program: BMB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2018 New Investigator

Return To Top

Marilynn Larson, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Pathology, Microbiology and Immunology

Research focus: Host and intracellular pathogen interactions, and determining the mechanisms that allow the Tier 1 select agent Francisella tularensis to persist and rapidly replicate within infected macrophages.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB and IPID

Robert Lewis, PhD

Professor, Eppley Cancer Institute

Research focus: Defining intracellular mechanisms required for the epithelia-mesenchymal transition (EMT) and the formation and maintenance of cancer stem cells.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, CR and IPMM

UNMC Award Recipient: 2018 Scientist Laureate; 2016 Research Leadership; 2006 Distinguished Scientist

Yulong Li, MD

Professor, Department of Cellular and Integrative Physiology

Research focus: Regulatory role of the peripheral nervous system in peripheral tissues (such as myocardium and skeletal muscle) in pathophysiological conditions, including heart failure, diabetes, ischemia-reperfusion injury, and peripheral artery disease.

Associated Doctoral Programs: IPMM and NSC

UNMC Award Recipient: 2018 Distinguished Scientist

Ming-Fong Lin, PhD

Professor, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Research focus: Mechanism of cell growth regulation by steroids via cross-talk of ROS and tyrosine phosphorylation signaling.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BISB and CR

Brian Lowes, MD, PhD

Professor, Department of Internal Medicine - Cardiology

Research focus: Novel education clinical trainees and education program with a goal to develop clinicians and scientists in sub-Saharan Africa.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, IPMM and MGCB

Guoqing Lu, PhD

Professor, Department of Biology & Interdisciplinary Informatics (UNO).

Research focus: Theoretical and applied bioinformatics, with a focus on comparative genomics and evolutionary informatics.

Associated Doctoral Program: BISB

Matthew Lunning, DO, MD

Associate Professor, Department of Internal Medicine – Oncology and Hematology

Research focus: Rare hematologic malignancies with a focus on early drug development and experimental correlates that leads to enhanced knowledge of how to treat hematologic malignancies.

Associated Doctoral Program: CR

UNMC Award Recipient: 2018 Distinguished Scientist

Xu Luo, PhD

Professor, Eppley Cancer Institute

Research focus: Molecular mechanisms and signaling pathways in cell death and survival in cancer cells.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, CR and IPID

UNMC Award Recipient: 2012 Distinguished Scientist

Quan Ly, MD, FACS

Professor, Department of Surgery

Research focus: Study of the role of cadherins in metastatic cancer cell signaling and effect of cadherin mutations on cell adhesion and cell motility. Evaluate NBL1 function by re-expressing NBL1 in cancer cells. Develop novel therapies for pancreatic cancers. Study the role of survivin in pancreatic cancers.

Associated Doctoral Program: CR

Yuri Lyubchenko, PhD, DrSc

Professor, College of Pharmacy

Research focus: Nanoscale structure, dynamics and interactions – seeing and manipulating biomolecules.

Associated Doctoral Program: CR

Return To Top

Sidharth Mahapara, MD, PhD

Associate Professor, Department of Pediatrics

Research focus: Elucidating pathophysiologic mechanisms triggering aggressive pediatric brain tumors using transcriptomic analyses to hone in on essential signaling pathways and to test synthetic inhibitors of these pathways; Repurposing FDS-approved drugs for treatment of aggressive pediatric brain tumors.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, CR and IPMM

Ram Mahato, PhD

Professor, College of Pharmacy

Research focus: Micelle and nanoparticle drug delivery; Oligonucleotides, siRNA, miRNA, and gene delivery; Synthesis of novel polymers, lipopeptides, lipopolymers and cationic lipids; Construction of gene and shRNA expression systems; Design and synthesis new compounds to overcome chemoresistance and inhibit hedgehog signaling pathway.

Associated Doctoral Program: IPMM

Roslyn Mannon, MD

Vice Chair, Department of Internal Medicine - Nephrology

Research focus: Mechanisms of long term kidney allograft injury both immunological and nonimmunological using in vitro studies.

Associated Doctoral Programs: IPID and IPMM

Luis Marky, PhD

Professor, College of Pharmacy

Research focus: Biophysical chemistry and molecular forces that control the conformational stability and flexibility of nucleic acids, including Okazaki fragments, hairpin loops, intramolecular triplexes, G-quadruplexes, C-quadruplexes, and three- & four-arm DNA junctions and their interaction with drugs.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BISB, BMB, CR and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipient: 2015 Research Leadership; 2006 Outstanding Faculty Mentor of Graduate Students

Aaron Mohs, PhD

Associate Professor, College of Pharmacy

Research focus: Development of new florescent imaging contrast agents to guide surgical removal of tumors; developing new drug delivery systems that multiple myeloma; developing pathogen biosensors.

Associated Doctoral Program: CR

UNMC Award Recipient: 2019 Distinguished Scientist; 2017 New Investigator

Daniel T. Monaghan, PhD

Professor, Department of Pharmacology and Experimental Neuroscience

Research focus: Development of drugs for modulating NMDA receptor activity for treating schizophrenia and autism.

Associated Doctoral Programs: IPMM and NSC

R. Lee Mosley, PhD

Professor, Department of Pharmacology and Experimental Neuroscience

Research focus: Regulation of T Lymphocyte function; T cell-mediated immunity in neurodegenerative disorders.

Associated Doctoral Programs: IPID, IPMM and NSC

Justin L. Mott, MD, PhD

Professor, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Research focus: Receptor tyrosine kinase and microRNA regulation of apoptosis in liver cancer and bile duct injury.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB and CR

UNMC Award Recipient: 2021 Interprofessional Academy of Educators; 2021-2022 Varner Educator Laureate; 2017 Outstanding Teaching Award; 2015 New Investigator

DJ Murry, PharmD

Professor, Department of Pharmacy Practice and Science

Research focus: Ways to individualize drug therapy using pharmacokinetic and pharmacogenomics information; from in vitro metabolism and transport studies, animal pharmacokinetic studies, to clinical studies evaluating drug therapy in patients.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, BISB, CR and MGCB

UNMC Award Recipeint: 2022 Distinguished Scientist

Return To Top

Prabagaran (Praba) Narayanasamy, PhD

Assistant Professor, Department of Pathology, Microbiology and Immunology

Research focus: Drug design, discovery and development (including drug delivery by nanomedicine) for infectious diseases; study of physiology and pathogenesis of bacteria and virus towards drug discovery; design, synthesis and characterization of substrates, inhibitors, intermediates, products and mechanisms for drug discovery and development.

Associated Doctoral Programs: BMB, IPID and MGCB
